articles.title: Seahawks’ Super Bowl parade and celebration: What to know - The Seattle Times
articles.description: Wednesday's parade will kick off after the trophy celebration at Lumen Field. While that celebration will require tickets, the parade will not.

articles.description: A fight broke out between the Detroit Pistons and Charlotte Hornets in the third quarter of Monday night’s game, and four players were ejected. Charlotte’s Moussa Diabate and Miles Bridges were tossed, along with Detroit’s Jalen Duren and Isaiah Stewart. The …

articles.title: Musician calls out Olympic figure skater Amber Glenn for allegedly using his song without permission - Entertainment Weekly
articles.description: Musician Seb McKinnon has questions after seeing figure skater Amber Glenn skate to his song 'The Return' at the 2026 Winter Olympics.

articles.description: After garnering Trump's ire for expressing 'mixed emotions' about representing the U.S., Olympian Hunter Hess reiterated messages of unity.

articles.description: The engaged internet celebrity couple turned on the waterworks after the Dutch speedskater captured first in the 1,000 meters.

articles.title: Judge rules 7-foot center Charles Bediako is no longer eligible to play for Alabama - AP News
articles.description: An Alabama circuit judge has denied Alabama basketball player Charles Bediako’s motion for a preliminary injunction, ending the 7-foot center’s collegiate eligibility and his season with the Crimson Tide. County Circuit Court Judge Daniel Pruet cited that Bed…

articles.title: Illinois governor says progress has been made on new stadium for Bears - NBC Sports
articles.description: The Bears are getting closer to their stated goal of building a new stadium in the Chicago suburb of Arlington Heights.

articles.title: 49ers' Keion White has surgery after being shot in ankle in S.F. - ESPN
articles.description: 49ers defensive lineman Keion White underwent surgery Monday after he was shot in the ankle in San Francisco hours after Super Bowl LX concluded.

articles.title: Lindsey Vonn says she suffered 'complex tibia fracture' in her Olympic downhill crash - NPR
articles.description: The 41-year-old star said her torn ACL was not a factor in her crash. "While yesterday did not end the way I had hoped, and despite the intense physical pain it caused, I have no regrets," she wrote.

articles.title: George Mason’s Ilia Malinin claims Olympic gold - George Mason University
articles.description: On Saturday, February 7, George Mason University student and reigning world figure skating champion Ilia Malinin helped power the United States to a team figure skating gold medal at the Milano Cortina Winter Games.
